description.para: Attempts to get Mutex Lock object.

param_note.para: Specifies a time delay, the unit is tick. If uTicks is zero, the function returns at once. If Mutex object is obtained, returns S_OK, otherwise returns S_TIMED_OUT.

tr.td: Function succeeds in attempting to get Mutex Lock object.
Wait time exceeds specified time-out period; i.e, the current thread cannot get the mutex object within the time-out period.
Interrupted while waiting for Mutex object.

return.para: References ECODE related help for details.

remarks.para: This function is used for attempting to get Mutex Lock object. If Mutex Lock object has been occupied by another thread, the calling thread will get into waiting state till it succeeds in occupying the Mutex Lock object. If the waiting time is over, the calling thread will finish waiting and return S_TIMED_OUT. If uTicks is 0, this member function returns immediately. If the calling thread occupies the Mutex object, it will return S_OK, otherwise it will return S_TIMED_OUT. If Mutex Lock object does not have any ownership, the calling thread will occupy the Mutex Lock object, and the function will return at once. If the calling thread occupies the Mutex Lock object, the function will return too. The calling thread should call the Mutex::Unlock function accordingly to release the Mutex Lock object. Thread can be interrupted while waiting for mutex object.
